Romero’s 1968 Night of the Living Dead spawned the full-feature zombie craze in the 80s and 90s and continued it well into the millennium.

River Queen attempts to pack a complicated, sweeping, historical narrative into just under two hours. There are some breathtaking battle scenes and the Wanganui scenery is beautiful, but the crowning descision on this film is the incredibly distasteful and unsuccessful attempt to make it into a love story. To top it off, the ever beautiful Sally Hawkins has been here cast against type, which is unfair, given that it makes her look absolutely ridiculous and undercuts her best talents.

The Bone Snatcher is about a group miners who go on a search for a missing crew of miners in the Namib Desert. When the find them, the crew are found in an area with spikes with feeding tubes going into their stomachs and into their brains. They group tries to make their way back to safety only to run into kidnappers looking to vivisect the missing crew. The group is able to escape and some kidnappers are killed but a couple survive.

I saw it tonight and fell asleep in the movie.
